description: This file contains environment utilities for a React application, including functions for reading environment variables, parsing feature flags, and exposing configuration details such as API base URL, data mode, log level, environment, and URLs for frontend and websocket connections.

methods.name: readEnv(key, defaultValue = undefined)
methods.description: Safely reads a string environment variable with optional default, trimming whitespace and returning default if unset or invalid.

methods.name: parseCSVFlagsToSet(value)
methods.description: Parses a comma-separated string into a set of normalized flags (lowercase, trimmed).

methods.name: setToMap(set)
methods.description: Converts a set of flags into an object map with flag names as keys and true as values.

methods.name: internalGetRawApiBase()
methods.description: Internal function to retrieve the API base URL from environment variables, prioritizing REACT_APP_API_BASE over REACT_APP_BACKEND_URL.

methods.name: getApiBase()
methods.description: Returns the API base URL if configured, else undefined.

methods.name: getDataMode()
methods.description: Determines if data should be loaded from API or locally based on environment variables.

methods.name: getFeatureFlags()
methods.description: Parses feature flags from environment variable REACT_APP_FEATURE_FLAGS into a set and a map.

methods.name: isFeatureEnabled(flag)
methods.description: Checks whether a specific feature flag is enabled, case-insensitive.

methods.name: getLogLevel()
methods.description: Retrieves the configured log level, defaulting to 'info'.

methods.name: getNodeEnv()
methods.description: Returns the current node environment, preferring REACT_APP_NODE_ENV over NODE_ENV, defaulting to 'development'.

methods.name: getFrontendUrl()
methods.description: Returns the frontend public URL if configured.

methods.name: getWebsocketUrl()
methods.description: Returns the websocket URL if configured.
